The SVG foreignObject attribute **systemLanguage** can be used to detect the OS language and display [this example page](https://itty.bitty.site/systemLanguage/#/data:image/svg+xml;charset=utf-8;format=gz,) in that language, defaulting to English if the detected language doesn't match.

The languages are:

* en (English, default)
* fr (French)
* de (German)
* ru (Russian)
* it (Italian)
* nl (Dutch)
* es-013 (Spanish)
* ja-JP (Japanese)
* sv-SE (Swedish)

and Indian languages:
* hi-IN (Hindi)
* bn-IN (Bengali)
* ta-IN (Tamil)
* te-IN (Telugu)
* gu-IN (Gujarati)
* pa-IN (Punjabi)
* ur-IN (Urdu)
* or-IN (Odia)
* mr-IN (Marathi)
